title: How would you describe yourself in just one title of a book? - Quora

response.answer_text: Five people you meet in Heaven I totally believe in the crux of this book. Everything happens for a reason and everybody you ever meet is somehow connected to you directly or indirectly. I meet a lot of people everyday, some i just see, some i just observe, some i’m a customer of while some are my colleagues, who I feel are connected to me in a way or other. While i don’t go up and talk with each and everyone of them, ever since, i’ve read the book, its just stuck in my head that everything is connected. Might sound crazy. Yes. But its a small world after all. A lil’ coincidence: I used to travel a route here everyday and i used to see a nice looking building while on this route. Me and my colleagues always used to wonder what was this nice structure in the middle of nowhere. 2–3 years down the road, that building is where i work. Strange!

“ The loneliness of a long distance runner ” Life is a marathon which we all have to complete, and believe it or not, we are all alone in this battle. People might support us from time to time, but at the end of the day it's your race and yours alone. P.S. - For those who have not heard the name of the book, it's a famous one by Alan Sillitoe published in 1959. A movie of the same name was also made based on the book.
